column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: This medication has helped me deal with the voices. I would recommend it to those individuals seeking relief.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Clozaril is the only medication that worked for my schizoaffective disorder.  I became a functioning human being and able to participate in every day life without voices constantly hounding me and confusing me.  The only draw back to this medication is that you have to get your blood drawn once a week for a whole year and if after that your stable it's fine but if your test comes back too low after that one year is up, you have to start the whole year over again - going once a week to get your blood drawn for the Clozaril.  But it's a sacrafice I'm will to make for this wonderful drug - Clozaril gave me back my life.  Thank You

column2: jennym1974, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: At first it was rough w/ the blood work every week. Now i just go every month. It's really a wonder drug for me, i've been out of the hospital for 2 yrs. & 3 mths.

column2: micup, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I've been on Clozaril for around 6 years after trying several other drugs --(Prolixin ZyprexaRisperdal---Each drug was effective in helping with intrusive thoughts and fear. However as a last ditch effort I was put on Clozaril for the lack of  severe side affects  (ie my eyes rolled to the back of my head, strange movements of my hands). With Clozaril I had mostly the best of both worlds.,

I have been on clozaril about a week for bi-polar and so far I had great results, even though I have only been taking it for a week. I feel like I am able to cope better on clozaril.  I have tried many drugs and clozaril works the best for me.

column2: bell, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: increadible weight gain...over double original weight

column2: Nate, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: My son Had taken a lot of drugs that was suppose to help Some helpeda little some made it worse some not at all . Clozaril Has made a world of differance. He acts more like himself.

column2: redwoman, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I took Clozaril for several years. Now I have severe memory problems. Such as remembering faces and names. Tasks that need to be done or schedules. I gained considerable weight, and have not been able to lose weight around the tummy. My doctor spent about three months getting me off of this and on another more recent drug. Thank goodness.

column2: FamilyFullOfCrazy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Caregiver)
column9: In 1982, my brother was diagnosed at the age of 20 with Schizophrenia and Bipolar-Manic Depressive. He has been on several anti-psychotic and anti-depression over several years. Appx 5 years after Clozaril being available he began taking it. It has been the most helpful and effective anti-psychotic medication for him. As most know, the lab work for blood draw is a pain (once a week!) but for the last year has been going once a month for labs. I also have a nephew that is diagnosed with the same illnesses and hoping he will get placed on Clozaril. If something new should come on the market that is just effective and mental health saving minus the labs, I pray for that day!! I just wish there was a cure for this "dreaming while awake with nightmares" mental illness. God's grace to all who suffer and help care for those with it! I am a caregiver and I salute those who endure!!!

column2: wolf, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Caregiver)
column9: My son was very ill and tried every treatment available.  Nothing worked that well until he started taking Clozaril.  He is now attending College with great grades and 90% of symptoms gone. We are so thankful.

column2: hype60ny, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Extreme weight gain.  Cured my insomnia.  Monthy bloodwork and doctors appt. required.  Taken at night puts you to sleep but wake up is much better than other anti-psychotics.  Causes pain in joints and muscles(not severe).

column2: sissbyoom49@yahoo.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: After prolonged use, memory problems seem to be increasing.  Very difficult to maintain employment and relationships when one cannot remember!  Otherwise it's been a godsend.

column2: MUGSIEMA@YAHOO.COM, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: I AM THE MOTHER OF A BI-POLAR SON WITH PSYCHIO-AFFECTIVE DISORDER. HE STARTED THIS DRUG A WEEK AGO AND SO FAR, HE IS STILL DILLUSIONAL AND VERY VERY SLEEPY.

column2: tigger, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Caregiver)
column9: This medication seems to be causing cognitive problems - memory; executive function, concentration etc.

column2: Heather A., 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: When I don't take the Clozaril, I can't sleep at night at all.  Why does this occur?When I do take the Clozaril, I get tired about 1 to 2 hours after I take it.  When I do take it I usually sleep through the whole night.  I have to get my blood drawn every other week, which I really don't like.I started taking the Clozaril about 8 to 9 years ago.  The thing I really hate is if I don't take it I can't sleep at all during the night. Why did they invent a drug that messes with your sleep patterns?  I hate that.  Honestly, I do!

column2: marydean, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Caregiver)
column9: my son has been on cloz since 1989.  if it had not worked hewould never have been dischargedhe was the 1st person to get it innorth dakota.
